name: Joy's Rockside House B&B

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in July, room was lovely and clean, breakfast delicious and owners very pleasant. Ideally located at the bottom of the Rock of Cashel, our room had a lovely view of the castle. Excellent B&B and great value, highly recommended!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.text: This B&B is literally next to the Rock of Cashel and is very quiet. It is not far from town and can be walked for those who are fit. The parking provided is vast and we had no trouble with our van.
reviews.title: Wonderful Proprietors
Best B&B at Rock of Cashel
reviews.text: The B&B is in front of a field with sheep and ducks which was so nice and yet they were not noisy.

reviews.title: Great Location, Great B&B, Great Hosts
reviews.text: I cannot comment on the breakfast because I was ill and did not have it, but my family members thought it was very good.
The room was small but nicely decorated and the bathroom had a shower. My only gripe is that no soap was provided which I thought was odd since a coffee/tea maker with instant teas/coffees/suger was.
reviews.title: Great Location, Wonderful Hosts
Fantastic B&B, Wonderful Hosts & What a View!!
reviews.text: I hardly know where to start to list the surplatives about Joy's Rockside in Cashel. First is the fabulous location; right at the foot of the Rock of Cashel. There is no B&B that is closer to the majestic monument. I fell asleep to views of the Rock lit up at night. The B&B is right around the corner from town so you can just park your car in their private parking lot and walk in for a night of fun in the pubs and not worry about driving. Even though it is close to everything it is a quiet location. Couldn't be more perfect for a visit to Cashel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with all the positive comments people have made about Joy's. It is a wonderful place. There is a picture someone has posted on the site that shows the Rock all lit up at night. It was the view from our room and no picture can capture how beautiful and inspiring the site was. The location, food, and especially the hosts were excellent.
reviews.title: As great as everyone says!!

likes.disliked: — Didn't have internet-but not that important

reviews.title: A gem
reviews.text: We enjoyed everything about our stay in Cashel, beginning with Joan, one of the owners of Joy's Rockside House. She personifies everything you expect in an Irish inkeeper - warm, helpful, gregarious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this B&B is first rate. I urge you to find out for yourself.
reviews.title: Perfect one night stay

reviews.text: Joy's Rockside House is a great location for a stay in Casheltown. It is literally one house from the Rock of Cashel, and there are beautiful views from the bedroom windows. It's a quiet street also within easy walking distance of Bru Boru (which is an absolute must and well worth the money!) and the town's pubs and restaurants. Our room was very clean and comfortable and the breakfast was well-prepared.
reviews.title: Great View of The Rock of Cashel

likes.liked: — The location, the cleanliness and the efficiency of the owner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Joy Rockside House was extremely clean, the owner was more than helpful and full of advice. The room was large and the breakfasts were good.
reviews.title: When everything is just right.

likes.disliked: — You won't hear any complains from me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hubby and I arrived off a plane in Shannon dead tired after an all night flight. We had reservations for 2 nites at Joy's Rockside. It was the very best decision we made on our whole trip! The drive to Cashel took us over an hour. We were told in the books we read that rooms might not be ready till afternoon. The luck of the Irish was with us!
reviews.title: Loved the Joys & the Rockside B&B!!

likes.liked: — The hosts, good information, clean, breakfast & location

reviews.text: Joan greeted us at the door of her pink house (it had loads of flowers lining the fence in front). She showed us right up to a large room overlooking the Rock of Cashels & invited us to have tea in the parlor. Even though there was a teapot in the room we decided to take her up on the offer. Smart decision. She and her husband Ren served us tea and snacks. They told us all about the area and what there was to see. Joan suggested we have a nap for the rest of the morning, then see the castle in the afternoon. I guess she could tell we were dragging.
reviews.title: Very nice. Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At that point the beds could have been made of nails and we would have slept like the dead. :-) Actually they were beyond comfortable. I think we slept for around 3 hours. We had lunch at a French cafe Ren recommended... it was fantastaic. The sun came out just for our visit to the castle. Next day we visited all the places the Joys' mapped out for us and it was perfect.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: I can only rate this B&B as a 5 on Trip Advisors scale. My own ratings:
reviews.title: Best B&B I have ever stayed at

description: A warm welcome to our award-winning B&B in a quiet area below the Rock of Cashel. Walk to pubs, restaurants, the Rock & Bru Boru. Private off-street parking. Clean, comfortable rooms are specially designed to pamper guests. There are wonderful views of the Rock from our house. Delicious breakfast choices. Cashel is an excellent base for daytrips and we are delighted to help you plan your journey. Let us share the real Ireland with you!
